content:
GWAS - Genome-Wide Association Study

Bioinformatics pipeline for performing genome-wide association studies to identify genetic variants associated with complex traits and diseases. Provides comprehensive quality control, variant calling analysis, and statistical association testing for population genetics research.

What is GWAS?

Genome-Wide Association Studies scan complete genomes from many individuals to identify genetic markers associated with specific traits or diseases. This pipeline automates the entire workflow from raw genetic data to association results.

Key Features

  • Quality Control: Comprehensive QC for genetic variants
  • Population Stratification: Principal component analysis
  • Association Testing: Multiple statistical models
  • Visualization: Manhattan and Q-Q plots
  • Containerized: Reproducible across platforms
  • Scalable: Handles large cohort studies

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Data Import: Read genotype and phenotype data
  2. Quality Control: Filter variants and samples by quality metrics
  3. Relatedness: Identify and handle related individuals
  4. Population Structure: PCA for stratification correction
  5. Association Testing: Test variants for trait association
  6. Multiple Testing Correction: FDR and Bonferroni corrections
  7. Visualization: Generate publication-ready plots
  8. Reporting: MultiQC summary reports

Scientific Applications

  • Disease Genetics: Identify disease susceptibility loci
  • Complex Traits: Study polygenic trait architecture
  • Pharmacogenomics: Drug response associations
  • Agricultural Genomics: Crop and livestock improvement
  • Population Genetics: Evolutionary studies

Analysis Methods

  • Linear Models: Quantitative trait analysis
  • Logistic Regression: Case-control studies
  • Mixed Models: Account for population structure
  • Genotype Imputation: Increase variant coverage
  • Meta-Analysis: Combine multiple studies

Advantages

  • Standardized Workflow: Community best practices
  • Automated QC: Comprehensive quality filtering
  • Flexible: Supports various study designs
  • Reproducible: Containerized environment
  • Well-Documented: Extensive usage guidelines

Input Requirements

  • Genotype Data: VCF, PLINK, or BGEN format
  • Phenotype Data: Trait measurements and covariates
  • Sample Sheet: CSV with sample information
  • Optional: Reference panels for imputation

Main Outputs

  • Association Results: Variant p-values and effect sizes
  • Manhattan Plots: Genome-wide significance visualization
  • Q-Q Plots: Test statistic calibration
  • PCA Results: Population structure analysis
  • QC Reports: Sample and variant quality metrics
  • Summary Tables: Top associated variants

Perfect for: GWAS • Disease Genetics • Complex Traits • Population Genetics • Pharmacogenomics
